author: The Wall Street Journal
description:
Neo is a home humanoid robot built by 1X Technologies. Since its announcement, many have wondered what exactly Neo can—and can’t—do on its own. Ahead of launch, WSJ’s Joanna Stern sat down with the company’s CEO, Bernt Bornich.

Chapters:
0:00 1X Neo’s CEO
0:41 Neo launch plans
3:23 Neo’s unique body
8:04 Why build robots that look like humans?
11:05 What Neo will do 
11:49 Teleoperation vs. autonomy 
16:17 Can Neo unload the dishwasher by itself?
21:22 Neo’s safety 
27:16 The future of robotics and Neo

Tech Things With Joanna Stern
Everything is now a tech thing. In creative and humorous videos, WSJ senior personal tech columnist Joanna Stern explains and reviews the products, services and trends that are changing our world.

#1X #Robotics #WSJ
title: 1X CEO Defends Neo Robot’s Safety, Teleoperation in Your Home and More | WSJ
